title: WHY IS AHRI so good?
body:
I just don't know why she is so good now but why is her winrate 57~% in ranked what the heck is this balance team doing?



 http://www.lolking.net/charts?region=all&type=champion-winrate&range=daily&map=sr&queue=1x1&league=ranked

replies.body:
Mobility on her Q is one hell of a drug. I sure as hell never would've predicted numbers like this when I first heard about the "compensation buffs." Turns out the balance team was right to be so cautious on the amount of damage they gave back to her, eh?

> Would not be surprised if favorable Zed matchup is most of the win rate increase. Very easy to Q Zed, then dodge his Q with your awesome MS.

I'd say it's not just zed. Anyone that relies on skillshots is gonna have a hard time against her now with her Q mobility, which is the majority of midlaners. Also, let's not forget that the ahri buffs came at the same time as two big assassin nerfs: fizz and akali. Both of their winrates have dropped significantly; if ahri is being picked in the same games as fizz and akali, it's only natural that ahri's winrate will go up.

She's much stronger in lane now.  Teamfight is some worse, but being better in lane usually is worth paying a pretty high price, since you emerge from lane with a gold lead to cover for the weakness.

Would not be surprised if favorable Zed matchup is most of the win rate increase.  Very easy to Q Zed, then dodge his Q with your awesome MS.

Perhaps the speedboost from Q allows her to more easily hit her Charm.

I think it's because Ahri can effectively deal with Zed mid.
If she actually is a counter to him now that win rate wouldn't be odd at all if Ahri vs Zed happens often enough.

I think she also can deal with Lee Sin better than most other champions can.

Movement speed on Q also makes it easier to not waste any Foxfires.

And well, her roaming is even better. Doesn't matter if she lost a little bit of damage when you have hard CC and the mobility to always show up to fights.
She has obscene amounts of mobility, lane sustain, and true damage.

Like I said, I haven't even played against an Ahri for months, let alone this recent patch, so I'm pretty apathetic about how strong she is or not.

An AOE skillshot on a 4-6 second cool down max rank and it scales off your AP? Puts Irelia's true damage to shame.
You have to consistently hit on its return (harder to do) and compared to chogath or darius this is nothing.
